message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to sell you this great product! I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to start with an offer of $100.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. Can you meet me at that price?
I understand you're interested in the product, but $90 is a bit low for me. I can meet you halfway, so I'm willing to offer it to you for $110.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit higher than that. How about $95? That's the lowest I'm willing to go.
I can see you're really interested in the product, and I'm willing to meet you a bit closer to your price. I'll offer it to you for $105.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit higher than $105. How about $100? That's my final offer.

I'm not willing to go any lower than $110, but I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll meet you right in the middle at $105, but I need you to agree to this price now, as I'm getting close to considering other offers.
I'm not sure I can go any higher than $85. That's the absolute max I'm willing to pay. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to consider other options.

I'm starting to think you're not serious about buying the product. I've already met you at $105, and now you're offering $85? I'm not going to go that low. I'll make one final offer: $108, and that's as low as I'll go.
I understand you're not willing to go any lower, but I'm still not willing to pay $108. I'll stick to my previous offer of $85. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to walk away.
